snippet: President Obama and his Russian counterpart, Vladimir V. Putin, disagreed about how to respond to rising bloodshed in Syria and called only for negotiations between the government and rebels that are given little chance of success.
abstract: Pres Obama and Pres Vladimir V Putin of Russia, in meeting during G-8 summit, disagree about how to respond to rising bloodshed in Syria and call only for negotiations between the government and rebels that are given little chance of success; remarks from other leaders at conference indicate that Putin is isolated in his support of Pres Bashar al-Assad.

byline.contributor: Stephen Castle contributed reporting from Enniskillen, and David Herszenhorn from Moscow.

lead_paragraph: President Obama and his Russian counterpart, Vladimir V. Putin, disagreed about how to respond to rising bloodshed in Syria and called only for negotiations between the government and rebels that are given little chance of success.

headline.main: Obama and Putin at Odds on Syria, but Want Talks
headline.print_headline: Obama and Putin at Odds on Syria, but Want Talks
